extendedIngredients.name: lime
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 lime, ½ juiced and the rest cut into 4

extendedIngredients.name: spring onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: bunch spring onions, trimmed and finely chopped

recipes.title: Corn cakes with avocado salsa

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé are my top picks for Mexican. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. The Rex Hill Willamette Valley Pinot Noir with a 4.6 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 29 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Rex Hill Willamette Valley Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: Aromas of violets, iris, ripe raspberries, dark cherries, rose, blueberries, wild strawberries and wet stones all emerge from the glass when the wine is first poured. As the wine opens, more savory aromas of wood smoke, cured tobacco, earth, sandalwood and cinnamon add complexity to the original aromatics. Structured, ripe and pure, the wine shows all hallmarks of the 2013 vintage.

recipes.instructions: In a bowl, combine the flour, egg, cornand half the onions with some seasoning,then mix well. Mix the avocado with theremaining onions, lime juice, corianderand seasoning, then set aside.Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick frying pan.Drop tbsps of the corn mixture into thefrying pan, smoothing them down toform cakes. Cook for about 2-3 mins oneach side over a medium heat, adding theremaining oil if you need to. Serve hotwith the avocado salsa, lime wedges and some warm refried beans.

steps.step: In a bowl, combine the flour, egg, cornand half the onions with some seasoning,then mix well.
Mix the avocado with theremaining onions, lime juice, corianderand seasoning, then set aside.

Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick frying pan.Drop tbsps of the corn mixture into thefrying pan, smoothing them down toform cakes. Cook for about 2-3 mins oneach side over a medium heat, adding theremaining oil if you need to.
Serve hotwith the avocado salsa, lime wedges and some warm refried beans.
